Hey guys.
I picked up Cossacks 3 for a reason, to support Ukraine, and damn, I didn't go wrong one bit.
This game is like a good old military classic, only after the upgrade, it's like you've got a fully-fledged commander's tactical board instead of a rifle.

I sat down ‚Äúfor a minute‚Äù to try it out... and woke up 8.5 hours later, completely drawn into this strategic meat grinder.
The game hits your brain like a combat drill at night without warning.

‚öîÔ∏èGAMEPLAY

There is no room for whining here!
Every battalion is a resource. Every order is a responsibility. Every failure is your fault and your war.

The battles are as dynamic as an airstrike.
Armies number in the hundreds, and you control the economy like a supply officer.
Everything rustles, builds, and moves you truly feel like a commander, not a clicker in a mobile sharashka.

üî•THIS IS THE BEST RTS FOR THOSE WHO LOVE HELL ON THE MAP!

Orders fly, musketeers whistle, and artillery fire rattles so loudly that the monitor vibrates.
When you watch 300 of your soldiers fire a synchronized salvo, you feel like you're commanding a personal mini-army of the 18th-century US.
Only without papers and bureaucracy, a clean war!

üá∫üá¶ THE GAME WAS PURCHASED IN SUPPORT OF UKRAINE. FACT!

I took this game because I wanted to support developers from Ukraine.
And damn, it's nice to know that my money wasn't wasted, but rather was spent on people who are doing the best strategy in the post-Soviet space.

üî• IT'S CONVENIENT AND PLEASANT TO HUMILIATE THE RUSSIAN ARMY HERE!

Want some combat-oriented mental cardio?
Take any European nation and steamroller the Russian army in the game, as it should be in the balance of the 18th century.

This is where you really feel it:
Economics, discipline, and tactics decide.
But stupid mob violence doesn't.

The game clearly conveys the difference between a professional army school and a chaotic mass.
And this, motherfucker, is nice!

‚ö°TACTICS, DEVELOPMENT, PLANS AS IN A MILITARY OPERATION

Want powerful development?
Get ready:

the economy under an iron grip,
unit production on autopilot,
artillery always on the flanks,
cavalry in reserve,
infantry in a dense line,
and churn out barracks like the Pentagon churns out budgets
It's really military logic that's at work here, not magic or fantasy.

üî•VERDICT

Cossacks 3 is a game where you don't play for a nation.
You're her damn Supreme Commander.

Action? Check.
Tactics? Just like on NATO training grounds.
Balance? Tough, fair, and demanding.
Emotions? So much so that I went into an 8-hour combat campaign without a break.

If you love strategy, discipline, war, order, tactics, and want to support Ukraine, then buy it without a second thought.

Cossacks 3 ‚Äì A Legendary Strategy Classic

Legendary game that never gets old! Cossacks 3 is, in my opinion, one of the best games ever made in this genre. The mix of massive battles, deep economic management, and historical accuracy makes every match unforgettable. No matter how many years pass, it still delivers that same excitement and challenge as the first time I played it.

If you love real-time strategy and epic historical warfare, Cossacks 3 is a timeless masterpiece that deserves a spot in every gamer‚Äôs library.
This is the most beautiful multiplayer game that could ever exist. The technique and the way players are arranged on the map make it special. There is no other game of such magnitude!

Cossacks 3 is a faithful remake of the classic real-time strategy series, bringing large-scale battles and deep historical strategy to modern audiences. The game excels in its massive army sizes, with thousands of units clashing on the battlefield, delivering a truly epic war experience.

The attention to detail in unit variety, historical accuracy, and resource management adds depth and authenticity to the gameplay. Players must balance economy, technology, and military tactics to dominate in campaigns or multiplayer matches.

While the graphics have been updated, some aspects feel dated compared to contemporary RTS games, and the AI can be inconsistent at times. However, the scale of battles and strategic options more than compensate for these shortcomings.

Recipe for Potato Dumplings (Varenyky)
Ingredients:
For the dough:
Wheat flour ‚Äì 500 g
Water ‚Äì 200 ml
Egg ‚Äì 1
Salt ‚Äì 1 tsp
For the filling:
Potatoes ‚Äì 1 kg
Onions ‚Äì 2
Lard or butter ‚Äì 50 g
Salt ‚Äì to taste
Ground black pepper ‚Äì to taste
Preparation steps:
Making the dough:
Sifting the flour: Sift the flour into a large bowl.
Making the dough: Add salt and the egg to the flour. Gradually pour in the water, constantly stirring. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Resting the dough: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or cover it with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preparing the filling:
Boiling the potatoes: Peel the potatoes, cut them into large pieces, and boil until tender in salted water.
Preparing the onions: While the potatoes are boiling, finely chop the onions. Saut√© the onions in lard or butter until golden brown.
Making the potato puree: Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the saut√©ed onions, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Forming the dumplings:
Rolling out the dough: Roll out the dough into a thin sheet about 2-3 mm thick. Use a glass or cutter to cut out circles approximately 7-8 cm in diameter.
Forming the dumplings: Place a spoonful of potato filling on each circle of dough. Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges tightly to seal the dumplings.
Cooking the dumplings:
Boiling water: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt.
Cooking the dumplings: Gently drop the dumplings into the boiling water, stirring carefully to prevent sticking. Cook until done (approximately 5-7 minutes after they float to the surface).
Serving:
Removing the dumplings: Remove the dumplings with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate.
Serving: Serve the dumplings hot, optionally drizzling with melted butter, sour cream, or saut√©ed onions.
Enjoy your meal!

negative.review: Can't get this game to work on my PC, seems to be trying to run the 32-bit version on my 64-bit OS. Janky graphics and complicated fixes for things that shouldn't be broken. Not a significant upgrade on the original anyway. Waste of money.

[H1] Remake, not a sequel [/h1]
Make no mistake this is a remake of the first Cossacks game, the studio calling it the third instalment is misleading and disingenuous. The game does not have any dynamic control over the isometric camera view as the trailers misleadingly show. 

[h3] The Single-player [/h3]
The campaigns were not improved upon from the original and much of the same mistakes of the antiquated design of scenarios is bizarrely carried over to their new additions. One of the most frustrating aspects of the scenario design is having enemy troops materialised from thin air in some corner of the map, or other triggers spawning troops in unnatural ways. The campaigns actively encourage you to rely on autosaves to figure it out, as the few messages you receive in the form of dialogue don't give an in-depth briefing on what you actually [b] need [/b] to do.

[h3] Localisation Issues [/h3]
Odd grammar, nonsensical text and directly translated eastern european idioms plague the game's dialogue and mission descriptions.

[h3] Poor AI [/h3]
None of the intricate formations seen in the trailers and that the game has to offer are seen anywhere, other than static fights in scenarios. The AI will conga-line and snake its armies towards you from across the map making them nothing but fodder for your cannons. The AI seems to have little regard for it's own artillery, often leaving them un-escorted or even rolling them right up to you, to be captured with ease.

[h3] "Current Year" [/h3]
Overall the old Cossacks gameplay loop actually holds up to the test of time, and this game is a perfectly adequate and competent RTS that suffered from a lack of polish. Today, given the difficulty of finding online opponents, I would not recommend this game as it's single-player offerings are rather meagre and appear to be an afterthought. This game had great potential and it was sad to see it squandered.

[H1] Remake, not a sequel [/h1]
Make no mistake this is a remake of the first Cossacks game, the studio calling it the third instalment is misleading and disingenuous. The game does not have any dynamic control over the isometric camera view as the trailers misleadingly show. 

[h3] The Single-player [/h3]
The campaigns were not improved upon from the original and much of the same mistakes of the antiquated design of scenarios is bizarrely carried over to their new additions. One of the most frustrating aspects of the scenario design is having enemy troops materialised from thin air in some corner of the map, or other triggers spawning troops in unnatural ways. The campaigns actively encourage you to rely on autosaves to figure it out, as the few messages you receive in the form of dialogue don't give an in-depth briefing on what you actually [b] need [/b] to do.

[h3] Localisation Issues [/h3]
Odd grammar, nonsensical text and directly translated eastern european idioms plague the game's dialogue and mission descriptions.

[h3] Poor AI [/h3]
None of the intricate formations seen in the trailers and that the game has to offer are seen anywhere, other than static fights in scenarios. The AI will conga-line and snake its armies towards you from across the map making them nothing but fodder for your cannons. The AI seems to have little regard for it's own artillery, often leaving them un-escorted or even rolling them right up to you, to be captured with ease.

[h3] "Current Year" [/h3]
Overall the old Cossacks gameplay loop actually holds up to the test of time, and this game is a perfectly adequate and competent RTS that suffered from a lack of polish. Today, given the difficulty of finding online opponents, I would not recommend this game as it's single-player offerings are rather meagre and appear to be an afterthought. This game had great potential and it was sad to see it squandered.

If you want to 100% the achievements then you need to know that it has multiplayer achievements.
And any game that is single player game and has those is never going to get a thumbs up.
